content: The Club of Rome is a think tank that was founded in 1968 by Alexander King and Aurelio Peccei. It is an international organization that aims to promote global sustainability and encourage dialogue on global issues. The Club of Rome is made up of scientists, economists, business leaders, and other experts from around the world. It conducts research on a variety of issues, including climate change, resource depletion, and economic development. The Club of Rome is known for its influential reports, including "The Limits to Growth" and "2052: A Global Forecast for the Next Forty Years." The organization has a goal of promoting the transition to a more sustainable and equitable world.
